title: Non-Game of The Year Awards 2022 - The Blessing Show
description:
It's that time of the year again, let's breakdown 2022 with Blessing Adeoye's awards show: The Non-Game of The Year awards.

Epic Creator Code: KindaFunny

transcript_chunks.text: the question on everyone's mind this game of the year season is about which was the better game God of War Ragnarok or Elden ring and while I understand where it comes from two AAA juggernauts pushing industry standards and game design polish and scope 2022 presented way more interesting matchups in my opinion like Sonic Frontiers versus Pokemon Scarlet for which broken game can sell more copies or OverWatch 2 vs Madden 23 for which game can iterate the least from their previous title there's also the battle between battle and Wonder World 2 vs arson for which Primal yuchinaka commit next the blushing shows non-game of the Year awards are about the lesser-known categories the categories that Jeff Keeley and IGN refuse to acknowledge so without further Ado let's break down what's up with the 2022 non-games of the year foreign expect to love this so much award 2022 was a year of surprises we got a Kirby game that took place within Alaska's game WWE 2k22 almost got me into the concept of

2022 non-games of the year foreign expect to love this so much award 2022 was a year of surprises we got a Kirby game that took place within Alaska's game WWE 2k22 almost got me into the concept of ultimate team and the cat from stray ended up being so cute that it hypnotized the world into nominating it for game of the year I'm off that cat this was the year of unexpected phase for me and for this award I got a shout out a few in particular I doubted multiverses from day one smash clones tend to have a low ceiling for quality and yet Multiverse is made up for it in fun gameplay a focus on online progression and a ridiculous character roster featuring LeBron James and Super Saiyan Shaggy Need for Speed Unbound was another surprise being the first Need for Speed to hook me in since the PS2 days and all it took was the power of anime and ASAP Rocky but the winner for this category has to be live alive and HD 2D remake of a Super Nintendo RPG never released in the west when it was

PS2 days and all it took was the power of anime and ASAP Rocky but the winner for this category has to be live alive and HD 2D remake of a Super Nintendo RPG never released in the west when it was announced I didn't originally have intentions of even picking up live alive but the art style was enough to pique my interest upon booting it up I couldn't pull myself away from it the Charming characters and fun stories turned live alive from a game I'd never heard of to game I'm gonna remember forever the best steam deck game if there's any console that Reigns Supreme in 2022 It's gotta be the steam deck like sure I got to play games like Horizon 3 and West and God of War Ragnarok on my PS5 but the steam deck changed the way I play games I'm a PC Gamer now so much so that Greg Miller is seeking my replacement and I'm PC gaming without even a mouse and a keyboard so much so that Andy Cortez is seeking my replacement the steam deck has made playing games old and new so much easier

is seeking my replacement and I'm PC gaming without even a mouse and a keyboard so much so that Andy Cortez is seeking my replacement the steam deck has made playing games old and new so much easier eliminating a lot of the hassle of PC gaming but also opening up the benefits of PC like a deeper library of games and a customizable experience I've gotten into games like Roblox C2 and vampire survivors went back to games like death stranding and inscription and even played some of my favorite Classics like Donkey Kong 64 and NBA Street volume 2. my steam deck game of the year though is none other than neon white neon white is a first person action game all about speedrunning to the end of each level as quickly as possible it's brilliantly designed but also addicting enough that it was great having it on the go plus the various control schemes available on the steam deck made it perfect for tweaking how I play the worst Square Enix game title I'm convinced Square Enix names their games

having it on the go plus the various control schemes available on the steam deck made it perfect for tweaking how I play the worst Square Enix game title I'm convinced Square Enix names their games the same way Donald Glover picked challenge Gambino as his rap Persona by using a name generator they found online and while I love games like live alive I'd be lying to you if I said I was 100 sure on pronouncing level live right this year from Square Enix we got Harvest Stella deal field Chronicle stranger Paradise Final Fantasy Origins Crisis Core Final Fantasy reunion Romancing Saga Minstrel song remastered Star Ocean the Divine Force triangle strategy voice of cards the beast of burden and dazzling Warrior the sacred Rune in the plastic world that last game is actually made up I got it from a jrpg name generator but for a split second you definitely believe me in that list I didn't even name every weird Square Enix title to come out in 2022 one that I left out in the winner for this

a jrpg name generator but for a split second you definitely believe me in that list I didn't even name every weird Square Enix title to come out in 2022 one that I left out in the winner for this category has to go to various Day Life a real name for a real Square Enix game that I refuse to believe wasn't made by a jrpg name generator the best Sonic thing 2022 might be the best year for Sonic the Hedgehog and the worst year for the guy that created Sonic the Hedgehog we got Sonic the Hedgehog 2 the movie that was for the second time in a row better than it had any right being we got Sonic Origins a re-release of the classic Sega Genesis games in one collection for modern platforms we got Sonic Frontiers the best 3D Sonic game in years shifting Sonic into an open Zone collect-a-thon that I damn near couldn't pull myself away from and surprisingly Frontiers isn't even my winner for this category because at the last second of 2022 Sonic Prime released on Netflix it's an eight episode

I damn near couldn't pull myself away from and surprisingly Frontiers isn't even my winner for this category because at the last second of 2022 Sonic Prime released on Netflix it's an eight episode animated series that is shockingly good it's all the Sonic characters you know and love along with a bunch of fan service including many video game references combined with a really good story invoking Concepts from into the spider-verse I watched the first episode just to check it out in the next day I binged the rest of the series it's that good and it's immense the fact that there's never been a better time to be a Sonic fan now give me Sonic Mania too the worst Trend this one is actually a tough one because as someone who talks about game news every single day there tends to be a handful of topics that cause eye rolls when they appear in headlines for the first half of the year it was nft stories for the second half it was the pandemonium of the Microsoft acquisition of Activision

of topics that cause eye rolls when they appear in headlines for the first half of the year it was nft stories for the second half it was the pandemonium of the Microsoft acquisition of Activision Blizzard in their battle against Sony and while these made up the bulk of controversial headlines in 2022 the worst Trend in my opinion exists as a multi-faceted issue plaguing game releases in the last few months alone we've gotten an increase of games releasing in less than ideal States Sonic Frontiers has some of the worst popping I've ever seen Pokemon scarlet and violet were doing their best impression of stop-motion animation in Marvel's midnight Suns and Coastal protocols suffered bad PC performance at launch of course a lot of this comes down to different variables and a worldwide pandemic doesn't help the difficulty of making games but one Trend does stand out to me in particular Platinum Games supermassive and Game Freak All released multiple games in 2022 and struggled doing so

doesn't help the difficulty of making games but one Trend does stand out to me in particular Platinum Games supermassive and Game Freak All released multiple games in 2022 and struggled doing so dark pictures Devil in Me was the buggiest of any of supermassive's games babylon's fall is one of platinum's worst releases of all time and even though Pokemon scarlet and violet are selling incredible numbers it's undeniable that their tarnishing Nintendo seal quality in my humble opinion what these releases all have in common is a focus on quantity instead of quality a focus on hitting deadlines instead of releasing the best product possible and I understand the business of video games and why 10 million sales for Pokemon might mean that releasing in the state at this time is a good move for sales but it's the worst Trend because very obviously it's a bad move for the games themselves the most underrated indie game in a year of underrated Indie Games 2022 was dominated by Indie releases a

but it's the worst Trend because very obviously it's a bad move for the games themselves the most underrated indie game in a year of underrated Indie Games 2022 was dominated by Indie releases a lot of which have gotten their flowers I can't stop talking about my love of sifu and stray even got nominated for Game of the Year at the game awards and I still don't trust that cat even though there are plenty of games that I feel are underrated like tinykin a stylish 3D platformer or even something like melatonin a chill little rhythm game there is one Indie that I will describe as criminally underrated and that's Patrick's Paradox Patrick's Paradox came out early in the year it is a puzzle game dealing and pushing boxes in recursive design the space that you're in is often the same as the box that you're pushing meaning you'll move in and out of these infinitely repeating spaces to solve puzzles that seem complex but are intuitive once you get the hang of it a game that makes you think

that you're pushing meaning you'll move in and out of these infinitely repeating spaces to solve puzzles that seem complex but are intuitive once you get the hang of it a game that makes you think outside the box and it's a game that deserves as many flowers as many of this year's best Indies the PS3 protagonist award remember during the PS3 and Xbox 360 era where we got a bunch of games filled with protagonists who all just seem like clones of the same boring man with short hair well 2022 is trying to give 2007 a run for its money we got characters like Jacob Lee from Callisto protocol who honestly would be fine if he had any personality going for him he's like a default creative character with Incredible graphics on that same note I want you to close your eyes and imagine Aiden from Dying Light too did you guess that this is him if you did you guessed wrong because this is actually him that is also a lie this is Aiden I played through this game one and a half times and I had to

Dying Light too did you guess that this is him if you did you guessed wrong because this is actually him that is also a lie this is Aiden I played through this game one and a half times and I had to double check to make sure I was grabbing an image of the right guy part of me wants to give this award to Joel from The Last of Us Part One a literal PS3 protagonist but even he is beaten out by the one and only Jack from stranger Paradise Final Fantasy origin the true winner of this category not just because his one note writing means he's hell-bent on killing chaos and nothing else all I care about is seeing chaos dead but because he's the only character this year to listen to Limp Biscuit on an iPhone and if that isn't taken straight out of 2007 I don't know what is best in-game choices there's nothing I love more in a game than dialogue choices choose your own adventures and the consequence that your favorite character might die because you up the Quarry definitely brought this last

nothing I love more in a game than dialogue choices choose your own adventures and the consequence that your favorite character might die because you up the Quarry definitely brought this last year with a return to that until dawn feeling but my winner here is as dust Falls every choice in this game feels substantial do I protect my wife or my child do I Rush the bad man with a gun or do I leave him be every decision feels life or death and I constantly stressed over the fates of my main characters as trapped in a Breaking Bad level scenario just looking for a way out also shout out to my guy game informers Alex and Aiken for starring in this game and now it's time for this year's most prestigious award the 2022 non-game of the Year Game of the Year award Game of the Year 2022 comes down to only two games and those games are stray and Kirby in the Forgotten land although I imagine some Outlets could end up giving it to Eldon ring or God of War Ragnarok that said the non-game of the

to only two games and those games are stray and Kirby in the Forgotten land although I imagine some Outlets could end up giving it to Eldon ring or God of War Ragnarok that said the non-game of the Year award is about honoring a game that deserves to be in those conversations alongside the Seafoods Horizons and plague tales of the world and there was one game last year that I'm utterly Blown Away hasn't gotten more of the conversation it deserves and that game is immortality immortality is not only the most unique experience I had in the video game last year it's one of the most interesting pieces of media I consumed in 2022. it's an FMV found footage game where you're responsible for restoring three lost films these films are fully written and brilliantly acted originally for the game as a player you're tasked with sifting frame by frame through each film out of order clicking on faces of props to jump to different scenes a gameplay hook that was surprisingly compelling Not only was

a player you're tasked with sifting frame by frame through each film out of order clicking on faces of props to jump to different scenes a gameplay hook that was surprisingly compelling Not only was I hooked on the gameplay of your mortality the game's mystery carries it to a level beyond what Sam Barlow's previous games her story and telling lies did there is an impressive density of content that is backed up with writing that dives into themes of Cinema sexuality and the long lasting nature of Art and stories it's a poignant game that much like Shadow Colossus gone home Florence and similarly Transcendent experiences reminded me of how special and versatile the medium of video games can be it's also backed up by a brilliant performance by the cast especially man and Gage who plays multiple protagonists across different films it's a mesmerizing experience and one of those few games I would love to erase for my memory just so I could play it again and here to accept this award is man

protagonists across different films it's a mesmerizing experience and one of those few games I would love to erase for my memory just so I could play it again and here to accept this award is man engage the brilliant actress behind the main character of immortality mainan take it away thank you so so much what do you mean non-game of the year what does that mean thank you so much for watching The Blessing show this episode is just the first of a brand new season we back not too long from now with another episode that you won't want to miss so stay tuned right here on youtube.com kind of funny games let us know in the comments below what some of your non-game of the Year awards are until next time it's been our pleasure to serve you
